intro: Chaptalia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Chaptalia mexicana is often found in rocky soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
